cs.man.ac.uk.sample

Class Sampler

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.sample.Sampler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISampler

    public class Sampler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISampler
    The class Sampler is the external interface for this file sampling code.
    Version:
    1.0, 05/30/14
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

      • doesMetaDataExist

        public boolean doesMetaDataExist()
        Specified by:
        doesMetaDataExist in interface ISampler
        Returns:
        true if the file to be sampled has existing meta data, else false.

      • getClassLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getClassLabels()
        Specified by:
        getClassLabels in interface ISampler
        Returns:
        the different class labels for the data in the file being sampled, i.e. for a two class data file this would return {0,1} or {"Negative","Positive"} for example.

      • getAttributeLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getAttributeLabels()
        Specified by:
        getAttributeLabels in interface ISampler
        Returns:
        if the data is an ARFF file or a CSV file with a header, then grab the names of the attributes - i.e. strings which describe the data in each column of the file.

      • getAttributeCount

        public int getAttributeCount()
        Specified by:
        getAttributeCount in interface ISampler
        Returns:
        the count of the number of data attributes in the file being sampled, essentially this value is the column count - 1 (this is minus 1, as one of the attributes is the class label).

      • getClassDistribution

        public int[] getClassDistribution()
        Specified by:
        getClassDistribution in interface ISampler
        Returns:
        the class distribution as an integer array, i.e. if there are 100 negative examples and 10 positives, then the negatives are treated as class zero and the positives as class one. So then: Negative Positive | | V V return { 100 , 10 } | | V V Index 0 Index 1

      • load

        public boolean load(java.lang.String path,
                    int classIndex)
        Description copied from interface: ISampler
        Loads a particular file which is to be sampled.
        Specified by:
        load in interface ISampler
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file to be sampled.
        classIndex - the column index of the class in the file being sampled.
        Returns:
        true if the file is loaded correctly.

      • sampleToCSV

        public java.lang.Object[] sampleToCSV(java.lang.String trainSetPath,
                                      java.lang.String testSetPath,
                                      int negTrainSamples,
                                      int posTrainSamples,
                                      double trainSetBalance,
                                      double testSetBalance,
                                      double labelling)
        Description copied from interface: ISampler
        Samples the file and writes the sampled output to training and test set files in CSV format.
        Specified by:
        sampleToCSV in interface ISampler
        Parameters:
        trainSetPath - the training set file to create.
        testSetPath - the test set file to create.
        negTrainSamples - the total number of negative examples to include in the training set.
        posTrainSamples - the total number of positive examples to include in the training set.
        trainSetBalance - the desired class distribution for the training set, i.e. trainSetBalance = 0.1 means that 10% of the training set will be positive, the remainder will be negative.
        testSetBalance - the desired class distribution for the test set, i.e. testSetBalance = 0.01 means that 1% of the training set will be positive, the remainder will be negative.
        labelling - the proportion of instances in the test set which should be labeled, i.e. labeling = 0.001 means that 0.1% of the test set will be labeled.
        Returns:
        an array containing values which describe the outcome of the sampling. These variables include: i) a boolean value which when true means the sampling was successful, else false. ii) a string message describing the outcome, which may contained detailed information if the sampling failed for some reason.

      • sampleToARFF

        public java.lang.Object[] sampleToARFF(java.lang.String trainSetPath,
                                       java.lang.String testSetPath,
                                       int negTrainSamples,
                                       int posTrainSamples,
                                       double trainSetBalance,
                                       double testSetBalance,
                                       double labelling)
        Description copied from interface: ISampler
        Samples the file and writes the sampled output to training and test set files in ARFF format.
        Specified by:
        sampleToARFF in interface ISampler
        Parameters:
        trainSetPath - the training set file to create.
        testSetPath - the test set file to create.
        negTrainSamples - the total number of negative examples to include in the training set.
        posTrainSamples - the total number of positive examples to include in the training set.
        trainSetBalance - the desired class distribution for the training set, i.e. trainSetBalance = 0.1 means that 10% of the training set will be positive, the remainder will be negative.
        testSetBalance - the desired class distribution for the test set, i.e. testSetBalance = 0.01 means that 1% of the training set will be positive, the remainder will be negative.
        labelling - the proportion of instances in the test set which should be labeled, i.e. labeling = 0.001 means that 0.1% of the test set will be labeled.
        Returns:
        an array containing values which describe the outcome of the sampling. These variables include: i) a boolean value which when true means the sampling was successful, else false. ii) a string message describing the outcome, which may contained detailed information if the sampling failed for some reason.

      • shuffle

        public boolean shuffle(java.lang.String outputPath)
        Shuffles the data set, and saves it to the output path.
        Specified by:
        shuffle in interface ISampler
        Parameters:
        outputPath - the path to save the shuffled data to.
        Returns:
        true if shuffled and saved successfully, else false.

      • getPathToPositiveMetaData

        public java.lang.String getPathToPositiveMetaData()
        Description copied from interface: ISampler
        Gets the path to the positive meta data belonging to the currently loaded file.
        Specified by:
        getPathToPositiveMetaData in interface ISampler
        Returns:
        the path to the positive meta data belonging to the currently loaded file, else an empty string if the file is not loaded.

        Specified by:
